comments: Bogdanovic (ATL) is in the paint for about three seconds when he is imminently actively guarding an opponent.
Bogdanovic (ATL) and Barnes (TOR) make clean ball contact as they pursue the rebound and any arm contact while the ball is loose is deemed incidental.
Huerter (ATL) extends his arm out on his contest and marginal contact occur with Barnes' (TOR) arm, which does not affect his ability to finish his shot at the rim.
VanVleet (TOR) reaches for the ball and marginal contact occurs as he brushes Hunter's (ATL) arm, which does not affect his ability to maintain his dribble or drive to the basket.
Siakam (TOR) jumps vertically and maintains a legal vertical position contesting the driving shot attempt by Hunter (ATL).

Achiuwa (TOR) makes clean ball contact to dislodge the rebound from Hunter (ATL). Any follow-through contact to Hunter's (ATL) head after the dislodge is deemed incidental. Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Siakam (TOR) legally contests Bogdanovic's (ATL) jump shot attempt.  Any "high-five" contact after the release is considered incidental.
Bogdanovic (ATL) moves alongside of Siakam (TOR) and marginal contact occurs as he removes his resting hand from Siakam's (TOR) back at the end of the drive.
Capela (ATL) is in the paint for about three seconds when the shot is imminent.
VanVleet (TOR) rests his hand on Young's (ATL) body after the release of his shot and marginal contact occurs, which does not affect his ability to follow-through on his jump shot attempt.
Hunter (ATL) has his arm slightly extended out and marginal contact occurs as he brushes Siakam's (TOR) arm, which does not affect Siakam's (TOR) SQBR at the start of the drive.
Bogdanovic (ATL) is moving laterally and not established in Siakam's (TOR) path when he makes contact with Siakam's (TOR) body, which affects his driving shot attempt.
Achiuwa (TOR) is in the paint for less than three seconds when he is imminently actively guarding an opponent.
Achiuwa (TOR) makes slight contact with the ball without dislodging it and then grabs Hunter's (ATL) wrist, which affects his dunk attempt.
During the inbound play, VanVleet (TOR) slides his hand off of Young's (ATL) shoulder and marginal contact occurs as the shot by Bogdanovic (ATL) is imminent.

Capela (ATL) maintains a legal guarding position by collapsing his arm in to absorb the contact during the play at the basket by Barnes (TOR). Any follow-through "high-five" contact after the release is deemed incidental.
Hunter (ATL) commits a take foul on Barnes (TOR).
VanVleet (TOR) makes clean ball contact to dislodge it from Young (ATL) during his play up the court.
Bogdanovic (ATL) commits a take foul on Achiuwa (TOR).
Trent Jr. (TOR) cleanly deflects the inbounds pass away from Bogdanovic (ATL) on his steal attempt.
Bogdanovic (ATL) reaches for the ball and makes contact with Trent Jr.'s (TOR) back, which affects his SQBR.
